notes: MetroRail Expansion Collection, RG C 0009, Houston Metropolitan Research Center, Houston Public Library.

Norman Bel Geddes was a famous American industrial designer and architect. One of his most well known designs was the Futurama Display at the 1939 World’s Fair, which depicted a futuristic city dominated by highways, cars, and suburbs.
Sigman Byrd, Sig Byrd’s Houston (New York: Viking Press, 1955), p. 83.
Dr. Sam Adams Interview with Marguerite Barnes, Barnes Research Materials MSS 455, Box 1, Folder 2.
College Park Memorial Cemetery was one of three African American Cemeteries in Houston. It was founded in 1896, but has graves that predate its official opening.
